context.p: The following steps outline the process of using the Add User Wizard of the IHTSDO Workbench IDE to construct a new user :

step.cmd: Invoke the Add New User wizard from the Admin menu in the Administrator's Window of the Workbench. If the Administrator's window is not visible, select it or open it from the Window menu. An interactive form appears in the editor's top toolbar. This form can be stepped through using the step buttons provided.

fig.title: Step 1: Add new user entry form

step.cmd: Enter the new user's name and password and then hit the step button.

fig.title: Step 2: Enter new user's name and password

step.cmd: Enter the administrator's name and password and hit the step button.

fig.title: Step 3: Enter administrator's name and password

step.cmd: Initial user permissions can be granted to a particular part of the taxonomy. This is done by dragging the appropriate taxonomy concept onto the form. In the example in Step 4: Drag and drop taxonomy for grant, a refset branch is being chosen for this user.

info.note: The back button on the form is disabled, because the new user's concepts have already been created and committed.

fig.title: Step 4: Drag and drop taxonomy for grant

step.cmd: Permissions to be granted to the user for the chosen part of the taxonomy are selected from the available user roles under the Terminology Auxilliary concept hierachy. Each role can be dragged onto the form and permission granted to the selected taxonomy hierachy using the add grants button of the form as shown in Step 5: Drag and drop roles.
Completion - the user role's details and roles created by the wizard can be inspected by selecting the user's username in the taxonomy pane under Terminology Auxilliary concept -> User

fig.title: Step 6: Inspect user and role association concepts

postreq.note: Steps 4-5 can be repeated without leaving the grant form. Permissions can be revoked or additional permissions granted at a later date via the Admin -> Modify User Role wizard.
